result.execSummary:
The defendant Colley C. Chavarria was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Colley C. Chavarria is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Colley C. Chavarria was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to set up a payment plan.

Sentence to commence no later than June 13, 2015 by 7:00 p.m.
Huber is granted.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Colley C. Chavarria

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DE called to request ext.  DE approved to make his late $50 pymt for Sept on 10-02-15 by 4:30pm.  DE stated he will pay the bal of $108 in full that day. jaf
DE called to state that he forgot to make his pymt by 4:30pm on 8-31-15.  Advised DE to have his pymt in by 4:30pm today. jaf
DE called to request ext for Aug pymt.  DE approved to make his pymt by 4:30pm on 8-31-15. jaf
From DE on 7-27-15 requesting ext.  Spoke to DE today & approved him to make July pymt by 4:30pm on 7-31-15. jaf
c: Def, Atty, DA, SCSO & Jail. eif
DE appeared.  DE to pay $50/mo comm 6-25-15.  $15 Pplan Fee added.  DE signed Pplan Agmt. jaf
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif
c: Def & Atty. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl.  DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Colley C. Chavarria appeared.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  ADA Sortedahl advises the court there is an agreement.  DE will plead to and state will move to strike the domestic abuse enhancer on Ct. 2.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 2 with the domestic abuse enhancer stricken.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 2 with domestic abuse enhancer stricken.  On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 & Ct 3. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

- DE sentenced to 20 days in the St. Croix County Jail
- Credit for 7 days already served
- DE to start sentence no later than June 13, 2015 by 7:00 p.m.
- Huber is granted
- Court costs of $243.00
- 20 days to appeal
Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements and Notice of Motion to Suppress Evidence. Filed by Atty Andrea. km
Pre-trial conference on May 6, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Colley C. Chavarria appeared.  Case recalled at 2:13 p.m.  Court proceeds to arraignment.  Court informs DE of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads Not Guilty on all counts.  Court enters a Not Guilty Plea.  Set out for PTC.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 2:15 p.m. lw

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Waiver, ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Colley C. Chavarria appeared.  Court called at 2:11 p.m.  Set for preliminary hearing. Court reviews the DE's right for a preliminary hearing. Court finds the DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably committed and the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Court adjourned at 2:13 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Appointing Atty Andrea. km
Preliminary hearing on March 27, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Ilyana C.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-No Contact with the State of Wisconsin except meeting with Attorney Andrea or for Court purposes.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Jennifer Anne Bork,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,  DF:  Colley C. Chavarria appeared from jail. Defendant has not been able to contact anyone on his behalf. Atty Andrea asks for a signature bond, ADA Bork argues. Court notes a letter received on behalf of the Defendant. Speedy prelim waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
filed on behalf of the Defendant. eif
Per EJL 3/5/15 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif
Bail/bond hearing on March 6, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Ilyana C. or residence 1601 at Heggen #216 Street Hudson WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Jennifer Anne Bork,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,  DF:  Colley C. Chavarria appeared from jail.  QUASH WARRANT. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Prelim demanded. ADA Bork requests $3000.00 CB, Atty Andrea argues.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
